snippet: Mark Crispin Miller of N.Y.U. argues that relying on electronic voting machines operated by private corporations invites fraud and poses a danger to democracy.
abstract: New York University Prof Mark Crispin Miller has been working to warn the nation that electronic voting machines owned and operated by private corporations are an invitation for fraud and a danger to democracy since Sen John Kerry lost the presidential election; critics on both the right and the left have dismissed Miller as a conspiracy theorist.
lead_paragraph: Mark Crispin Miller of N.Y.U. argues that relying on electronic voting machines operated by private corporations invites fraud and poses a danger to democracy.

headline.seo: N.Y.U. Professor Is Skeptical About Integrity of Electoral Process
headline.main: Long Day for a Professor Suspicious of Voting Machines
headline.print_headline: Long Day for a Professor Suspicious of Voting Machines
